intro: Mespilodaphne phillyreoides, commonly known as the silky glabrous tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
